Paragraph: In an open , cross - over , controlled design , patients were randomized to receive either DCF per os or GTN patches the first days of menses , when menstrual cramps became unendurable .

| Chemical |
| --- |
| DCF (Diclofenac) |

In the given paragraph, the two mentioned chemicals are Diclofenac (DCF) and Glyceryl trinitrate (GTN).

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Diclofenac (DCF) |

In the revised paragraph, only the chemical entity "Diclofenac (DCF)" is present. The term "GTN patches" refers to a specific delivery form of the chemical entity Glyceryl trinitrate (GTN), but since the paragraph only mentions "GTN," it does not provide enough context to distinguish between the chemical and its delivery form. Therefore, only Diclofenac is identified as a chemical entity in the table.
